intro: Pycnostachys pallide-caerulea, commonly known as the pale skyblue pycnostachys, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking, pale blue to sky-blue flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to several meters. Its leaves are usually ovate or elliptical, with a smooth surface and a slightly hairy texture. The flowers are clustered in inflorescences and bloom during the wet season, attracting various pollinators.
